content_summary: The speaker discusses an experiment where an eye was placed on a tadpole's tail, which surprisingly allowed the tadpole to see. This is attributed to cellular plasticity and the ability of biological systems to adapt to new sensorimotor architectures without the need for evolutionary mutation and selection. The speaker uses this as a model of unconventional intelligence.
